prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base Part Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism will have a small indentation on one of its sides. 1. **Creating the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. **Creating the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face (face_1) containing a loop (loop_1) made up of four lines. The lines are defined as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0321, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.0321, 0.0], End Point [0.0321, 0.075] - line_3: Start Point [0.0321, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.075] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scaling the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.075. 4. **Transforming the 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. **Extruding the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a distance of 0.75 to create the 3D model of the prism. Part 2: Creating the Indentation Create an indentation on one side of the prism. 1. **Creating the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0161, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Creating the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face (face_1) containing a loop (loop_1) made up of three lines. The lines are defined as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0201, 0.075] - line_2: Start Point [0.0201, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.075] - line_3: Start Point [0.0, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scaling the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.075. 4. **Transforming the 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. **Extruding the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch both ways along the normal vector by a distance of 0.0107 to create the indentation on the prism. Part 3: Creating the Sloped Side Create a sloped side on the prism. 1. **Creating the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0161, 0.7299, 0.0] 2. **Creating the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face (face_1) containing a loop (loop_1) made up of three lines. The lines are defined as follows: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0201, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.0201, 0.0], End Point [0.0201, 0.075] - line_3: Start Point [0.0201, 0.075]</description>

prompt: <description>**Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side** Construct the first part of the final shape, which is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for this part. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face, face_1. On face_1, draw the following loops and curves: - loop_1 - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.15] - line_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.15] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - euler_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 45.0] (45 degrees rotation around the Z-axis) - translation_vector = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.125 units. The extrusion opposite the normal direction should be 0.0 units. The sketch scale factor should be 0.75. This part should be joined with the previous part using the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation. **Rectangular Prism with Parallel Sides** Construct the second part of the final shape, which is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for this part. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face, face_1. On face_1, draw the same loops and curves as part_1: - loop_1 - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.15] - line_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.15] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same euler angles and translation vector as part_1: - euler_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 45.0] - translation_vector = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.125 units. The extrusion opposite the normal direction should be 0.0 units. The sketch scale factor should be 0.75. This part should be created as a new solid body using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation. The dimensions of both parts and the final shape are as follows: - Height (of both parts and final shape): 0.125 units - Width (of both parts and final shape): 0.75 units - Length (of parts_1 and 2): 0.75 units - Length (of final shape): 2.0 units Note that the dimensions of the parts may vary slightly due to the scaling and boolean operations applied.</description>
